<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) Proportion of total progeny that's homozygous. (c) Assuming complete dominance, proportion of phenotypes showing the dominant form for all five.

Alright, starting with part (a). Selfing implies that each gamete formed from the parent's gametes would be fertilized back with the parent's own alleles. Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

For five independent genes, each with p = 1/4,

Number of ways to choose k genes out of 5: C(5,k)
Probability of exactly k genes being homozygous: C(5,k)*(1/4)^k*(3/4)^(5-k)

So the cumulative probability for at least one gene being homozygous is:

Sum from k=1 to 5 of [C(5,k)*(1/4)^k*(3/4)^(5−k)]

C(5,1)=5

For k=3:

For k=4:
C(5,4)=5
Probability = 5*(1/4)^4*(3/4)^1 ≈5*0.00390625*0.75≈5*0.00293≈0.01465

For k=5:
C(5,5)=1
Probability = (1/4)^5≈0.0009766

Adding them up: ~0.3955 + 0.263 + 0.08789 + 0.01465 + 0.0009766 ≈ 0.7619

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>
